alert.note: Alert for Logan; Morgan; Washington (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 8:35AM MDT until June 29 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River near Balzac affecting Morgan, Logan and Washington Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...South Platte River near Balzac. * WHEN...From this morning to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, The river is out of its banks and into fields and meadows. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.0 feet this evening. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
